page.title: 08Badgers Hill,Church Lench
page.content: Badgers Hill reserve was given to Worcestershire Nature Conservation Trust in 1978. The reserve covers some 5.5 acres on the top of Bishampton Bank,the soil is heavy liassic clay.There is some sign of ridge and furrow indicating some previous cultivation. The site is mainly hawthorn scrub, but includes ash, common and turkey oaks.There is a small area of open grassland and noted flowers include various orchids.Birds include warblers lesser spotted woodpeckers,and occasional nightingales.Badgers regularly visit the area. To the south of Church Lench are 2 shallow pools which were excavated in the early 70's.Swans, coot and tufted duck are regular visitors. Also seen -finches,sedge warblers and buntings.
